Package org.team19

Class TableFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.team19.TableFormatter
  • public final class TableFormatter
extends Object
    Creates the String form of a table from a list of string column headers, a list of lists with each list representing a column, and a list of TableFormatter.Alignments corresponding to whether a column should be left-aligned or right-aligned

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  TableFormatter.Alignment
      Represents the direction that a column in a table should be aligned

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected String horizontalDivider
      The string form of the character to use where two rows intersect
      protected String intersection
      The string form of the character to use in table corners or where both rows and columns intersect
      protected String verticalDivider
      The string form of the character to use where two columns intersect

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor Description

      Initializes a TableFormatter

      • TableFormatter

        public TableFormatter​(char intersection,
                      char horizontalDivider,
                      char verticalDivider)
        Initializes a TableFormatter
        Parameters:
        intersection - The string form of the character to use in table corners or where both rows and columns intersect
        horizontalDivider - The character to use where two rows intersect
        verticalDivider - The character to use where two columns intersect

    • Method Detail

      • objColTableToStrRowTable

        protected List<List<String>> objColTableToStrRowTable​(List<String> headers,
                                                      Collection<? extends Collection<?>> colTable,
                                                      int numRows,
                                                      int numCols)
        Given a List of string column headers and a table of objects with each List in the table representing a column, returns a table that includes the string column headers and the string forms of the aforementioned objects; however, each list composing the returned table represents a rows instead of a column
        Parameters:
        headers - The list of column headers
        colTable - The headerless table of objects with each list representing a column
        numRows - The number of rows in the table, including the headers as a row
        numCols - The number of columns in the table
        Returns:
        The provided table but all objects are in string form, the column headers are added, and the table is returned as a list of rows

      • getColumnLengths

        protected int[] getColumnLengths​(List<List<String>> strRowTable,
                                 int numCols)
        Given the string form of the table, returns the maximum lengths of the strings in each column
        Parameters:
        strRowTable - The string row list representation of the object column list table
        numCols - The number of columns the table contains
        Returns:
        The maximum lengths of the strings in each column of the given table

      • getTableFormat

        protected String getTableFormat​(List<TableFormatter.Alignment> alignments,
                                int[] columnLengths,
                                int numCols)
        Returns the formatting string for a row of data in the table
        Parameters:
        alignments - The list of alignments corresponding to each column
        columnLengths - The array consisting of the lengths of the longest strings in each column
        numCols - The number of columns in the table
        Returns:
        The formatting string for a row of data in the table

      • getHorizontalDivider

        protected String getHorizontalDivider​(int[] columnLengths,
                                      int numCols,
                                      String terminalCharStr)
        Returns a horizontal separator for the table
        Parameters:
        columnLengths - The array consisting of the lengths of the longest strings in each column
        numCols - The number of columns in the table
        terminalCharStr - The string form of the character to use on the beginning and end of the separator
        Returns:
        A horizontal divider for the table

      • formatAsTable

        public String formatAsTable​(List<String> headers,
                            Collection<? extends Collection<?>> colTableData,
                            List<TableFormatter.Alignment> alignments)
                     throws NullPointerException,
                            IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a string representation of a table from a list of string column headers, a list of lists with each list representing a column, and a list of TableFormatter.Alignment corresponding to whether a column should be left-aligned or right-aligned
        Parameters:
        headers - The list of column headers for the table
        colTableData - The headerless table of objects with each list representing a column
        alignments - The alignments corresponding to each column
        Returns:
        A string representation of a table from a list of string column headers, a list of lists with each list representing a column, and a list of TableFormatter.Alignment corresponding to whether a column should be left-aligned or right-aligned
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Thrown if any of the given lists are null
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the number of columns in provided either does not match the length of the column headers or the length of the alignments

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the string form of this TableFormatter
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        The string form of this TableFormatter in the form "TableFormatter{intersection='[intersection]', horizontalDivider='[horizontalDivider]', verticalDivider='[verticalDivider]'}" where [intersection], [horizontalDivider], and [verticalDivider] correspond to the field variables' string forms

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(Object other)
        Returns true if the other object is equivalent
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        other - The object to compare to this TableFormatter
        Returns:
        True if the other object is a TableFormatter with the same intersection, horizontalDivider, and verticalDivider
